means: 总督（或州长等地方行政长官）的职位（或职责、任期）

sentence.Network_en: He had worked closely with the President during his governorship.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在任州长期间与总统紧密合作。

sentence.Network_en: The governorship went to a Democrat, Mrs Anne Richards.
sentence.Network_cn: 民主党人安妮·理查兹夫人当选为州长。

sentence.Network_en: The Workers' Party failed to win a single governorship.
sentence.Network_cn: 劳工党连一个州长职位也未能赢得。

list.abs: Shami is the only foreign-born immigrant to run for the governorship .沙米出生在巴基斯坦，曾从事美发师职业，是唯一一名在国外出生竞选州长的移民。
i no longer wish to take the governorship of macedonia ., 我不想去做马其顿的总督.
Clinton was elected Arkansas Attorney in 1976 and won the governorship in 1978 .1976年，克林顿当选为阿州的司法部长。1978年，当选为州长。
on the population problem of hebei province in the period of military governorship of tang dynasty唐河北藩镇时期人口问题试探

entry.def: The governorship of a particular country or state is the position of being its governor. Governorship is also used to refer to the period of time a particular person spends being the governor of a country or state.

example.ex: The governorship went to a Democrat, Mrs Anne Richards...
example.tran: 民主党人安妮·理查兹夫人当选为州长。

example.ex: He had worked closely with the President during his governorship.
example.tran: 他在任州长期间与总统紧密合作。

auth_sentence.content: Illinois Republicans would be better off spending their time devising a strategy to win the statehouse and governorship.
